channel.title: News feed?
channel.description:
I am asking me, why there is no RSS or ATOM news feed here.
Or is the Twitter page meant to be a replacement?

item.title: News feed?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Oh shit, look out for the badass crazy guy here!

The only badass schizophrenic dude is that guy from Fight Club.

Read full topic

item.title: News feed?

item.description:
Malcomy:

To be honest, I just wanted to imply that I am schizophrenic and talking to myself.

Oh shit, look out for the badass crazy guy here!

Read full topic

item.title: News feed?
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
There’s no RSS feed, but there aren’t really enough updates to merit one. I understand the wiki is full of goodies, but there’s no development updates around here

However, if you keep an eye on any developer’s little steam card things that show up on their posts you’ll see they’re still working away in SDK, so its getting there

Read full topic

item.title: News feed?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Arthur: I am asking me if there’s an RSS news feed for this site.
Mercian Guard 1: If you’re asking yourself, why are you asking a forum?
Mercian Guard 2: Perhaps he meant that he wondered and translated it from Dutch.
Arthur: I just want to know if there’s an RSS news feed for this site.
Mercian Guard 1: But Dutch is just a version of German.
Mercian Guard 2: Yes, but English is just a version of Saxon.
Mercian Guard 1: Except modern German has no more to do with the West Germanic dialects it came from than Dutch. English is a different story because it was mixed with other Germanic dialects, and Latin/French.
Mercian Guard 2: But that doesn’t explain the coconuts.
Mercian Guard 1: What?
Mercian Guard 2: 'e’s got two empty 'alves of coconuts that ‘e’s bangin’ together! Where did you find them?
Arthur: Please, I just want to know if there’s an RSS feed for this site!
Mercian Guard 2: …lissen, if you have two empty 'alves of coconuts, you 'ad to get 'em from somewhere. Where did you get 'em?

Read full topic

item.title: News feed?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
pfannkuchen_gesicht:

dutch is like a fucked up version of german

pfannkuchen_gesicht:

and english is like an awesome version of the german dialect saxon(which is indeed the source of english)

Except modern German has no more to do with the West Germanic dialects it came from than Dutch. English is a different story because it was mixed with other Germanic dialects, and Latin/French.

Read full topic

item.title: News feed?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
pretty sure he meant ‘I wonder,’ which is probably something close to the literal translation for ‘I ask me’ (like ‘ik vraag me af’ in Dutch).

But yes, Twitter.

Read full topic

But yes, Twitter.
